Instantiate a Gateway objectÂ¶

class Gateway(host[, port = 80][, https = False])Â¶
Parameters

  • host (str) â The fully qualified domain name, hostname or an IPv4 address of the Gateway

  • port (int) â Set a custom port number (0 - 65535), defaults to 80

  • https (bool) â Set to True to require HTTPS, defaults to False

filer = Gateway('10.100.102.4') # will use HTTP over port 80

filer = Gateway('10.100.102.4', 8080) # will use HTTP over port 8080

filer = Gateway('vGateway-0dbc', 443, True) # will use HTTPS over port 443

Warning

for any certificate related error, this library will prompt for your consent in order to proceed. to avoid the prompt, you may configure chopin-core to automatically trust the serverâs certificate, using: config.http['ssl'] = 'Trust'

Logging inÂ¶

Gateway.test()Â¶

Verification check to ensure the target host is a Gateway.

filer.test()
Gateway.login(username, password)Â¶

Login to the Gateway.

Parameters

  • username (str) â username

  • password (str) â password

filer.login('admin', 'G3neralZ0d!')
Gateway.logout()Â¶

Logout from Gateway.

filer.logout()
Gateway.whoami()Â¶

Return the name of the logged in user.

Returns

the name of the logged in user

Return type

str

filer.whoami()

Core MethodsÂ¶

Gateway.show(path)Â¶

Print a Gateway schema object as a JSON string.

filer.show('/status/storage/volumes')
Gateway.show_multi(paths)Â¶

Print one or more Gateway schema objects as a JSON string.

filer.show_multi(['/config/storage/volumes', '/status/storage/volumes'])
Gateway.get(path)Â¶

Retrieve a Gateway schema object as a Python object.

"""Retrieve the device configuration and print it as JSON string"""

config = filer.get('/config')
print(config)

"""Retrieve the device settings and print the hostname and location settings"""

settings = filer.get('/config/device')

print(settings.hostname)
print(settings.location)

"""Retrieve a list of volumes and print the name of the first volume"""

volumes  = filer.get('/status/storage/volumes') # returns a list of volumes

print(volumes[0].name) # will print the name of the first volume

"""Retrieve the network settings and print the MTU setting"""

network  = filer.get('/config/network') # returns network settings

print(network.ports[0].ethernet.mtu) # will print the MTU setting
Gateway.get_multi(paths)Â¶

Retrieve one or more Gateway schema objects as a Python object.

"""Retrieve '/config/cloudsync' and '/proc/cloudsync' at once"""

device = filer.get_multi(['/config/cloudsync', '/proc/cloudsync'])

print(device.config.cloudsync.cloudExtender.operationMode)
print(device.proc.cloudsync.serviceStatus.uploadingFiles)
Gateway.put(path, value)Â¶

Update a Gateway schema object or attribute.

"""Disable the first time wizard"""

filer.put('/config/gui/openFirstTimeWizard', False)

"""Turn off FTP access on all shares"""

shares = filer.get('/config/fileservices/share')

for share in shares:

    share.exportToFTP = False

    filer.put('/config/fileservices/share/' + share.name, share)
Gateway.execute(path, name[, param = None])Â¶

Execute a Gateway schema object method.

"""Execute the file-eviction process"""

filer.execute('/config/cloudsync', 'forceExecuteEvictor') # doesn't require a param

"""Reboot the Gateway"""

filer.execute('/statuc/device', 'reboot') # doesn't require a param

"""TCP Connect"""

param = Object()

param.address = 'chopin.ctera.com'

param.port = 995 # CTTP

bgTask = filer.execute('/status/network', 'tcpconnect', param)

print(bgTask)

See also

Execute the file-eviction process: Gateway.force_eviction(), Reboot the Gateway: Gateway.reboot(), Execute tcp connect: Gateway.tcp_connect()

Gateway.add(path, param)Â¶

Add a Gateway schema object.

"""Add a user account"""

user = Object()

user.username = 'mickey'

user.fullName = 'Mickey Mouse'

user.email = 'm.mouse@disney.com'

user.uid = 1940

user.password = 'M!niM0us3'

filer.add('/config/auth/users', user)
Gateway.delete(path)Â¶

Delete a Gateway schema object.

"""Delete a user account"""

user = 'mickey'

filer.delete('/config/auth/users/' + user)

SharesÂ¶

Gateway.add_share(name, directory[, acl = []][, access = 'winAclMode'][, csc = 'manual'][, comment = None][, exportToAFP = False][, exportToFTP = False][, exportToNFS = False][, exportToPCAgent = False][, exportToRSync = False])Â¶

Add a network share.

Parameters

  • name (str) â the share name

  • directory (str) â full directory path

  • acl (list[tuple(str, str, str)]) â a list of 3-tuple access control entries

  • access (str) â the Windows File Sharing authentication mode, defaults to winAclMode

  • csc (str) â the client side caching (offline files) configuration, defaults to manual

  • comment (str) â comment

  • exportToAFP (bool) â whether to enable AFP access, defaults to False

  • exportToFTP (bool) â whether to enable FTP access, defaults to False

  • exportToNFS (bool) â whether to enable NFS access, defaults to False

  • exportToPCAgent (bool) â whether to allow as a destination share for CTERA Backup Agents, defaults to False

  • exportToRSync (bool) â whether to enable access over rsync, defaults to False

"""
Create an ACL-enabled cloud share called 'Accounting' and define four access control entries:

1) Everyone - Read Only (Local Group)
2) admin - Read Write (Local User)
3) Domain Admins - Read Only (Domain Group)
4) bruce.wayne@ctera.com - Read Write (Domain User)

Principal Type:
- LG: Local Group
- LU: Local User
- DG: Domain Group
- DU: Domain User

Access:
- RW: Read Write
- RO: Read Only
- NA: No Access
"""

filer.add_share('Accounting', 'cloud/users/Service Account/Accounting', acl = [ \
    ('LG', 'Everyone', 'RO'), \
    ('LU', 'admin', 'RW'), \
    ('DG', 'CTERA\Domain Admins', 'RO'), \
    ('DU', 'bruce.wayne@ctera.com', 'RW') \
])

"""Create an 'Only Authenticated Users' cloud share called 'FTP' and enable FTP access to everyone"""

filer.add_share('FTP', 'cloud/users/Service Account/FTP', acl = [ \
    ('LG', 'Everyone', 'RW')
], exportToFTP = True)
Gateway.add_share_acl(name, acl)Â¶

Add one or more access control entries to an existing share.

Parameters

  • name (str) â the share name

  • acl (list[tuple(str, str, str)]) â a list of 3-tuple access control entries

"""Add two access control entries to the 'Accounting' share"""

filer.add_share_acl('Accounting', [ \
    ('DG', 'CTERA\leadership', 'RW'), \
    ('DU', 'clark.kent@ctera.com', 'RO') \
])
Gateway.remove_share_acl(name, acl)Â¶

Remove one or more access control entries from an existing share.

Parameters

  • name (str) â the share name

  • acl (list[tuple(str, str)]) â a list of 2-tuple access control entries

"""Remove two access control entries from the 'Accounting' share"""

filer.remove_share_acl('Accounting', [ ('DG', 'CTERA\leadership'), ('DU', 'clark.kent@ctera.com') ])
Gateway.delete_share(name)Â¶

Delete a share.

filer.delete_share('Accounting')

Code SnippetsÂ¶

Disable all file-access protocols on all shares

shares = filer.get('/config/fileservices/share') # obtain a list of all shares

for share in shares:

    share.exportToAFP = False            # Apple File Sharing

    share.exportToFTP = False            # FTP

    share.exportToNFS = False            # NFS

    share.exportToRSync = False          # rsync

    share.exportToPCAgent = False        # CTERA Agent

    share.indexed = False                # Search

    filer.put('/config/fileservices/share/' + share.name, share) # apply changes

UsersÂ¶

Gateway.add_user(username, password[, fullName = None][, email = None][, uid = None])Â¶

Add a local user account.

Parameters

  • username (str) â username

  • password (str) â password

  • fullName (str) â first and last name

  • email (str) â email address

  • uid (int) â custom uid

filer.add_user('Clark', 'Kryptonite1!') # without a full name, email or custom uid

filer.add_user('alice', 'W!z4rd0fOz!', 'Alice Wonderland') # including a full name

filer.add_user('Bruce', 'GothamCity1!', 'Bruce Wayne', 'bruce.wayne@we.com', uid = 1940) # all
Gateway.delete_user(username)Â¶

Delete a local user account.

Parameters

username (str) â username

filer.delete_user('alice')
Gateway.add_first_user(username, password[, email])Â¶

Add the first admin account.

Parameters

  • username (str) â username

  • password (str) â password

  • email (str) â email

filer.add_first_user('admin', 'L3tsG3tR34dyT0Rumbl3!')

GroupsÂ¶

Gateway.add_members(group, members)Â¶

Add one or more members to a local group.

Parameters

  • group (str) â name of a local group

  • members (list[tuple(str, str)]) â a list of 2-tuple members to add

"""Add Bruce Wayne to the local Administrators group"""

filer.add_members('Administrators', [('DU', 'bruce.wayne@we.com')])

"""Add Bruce Wayne and Domain Admins to the local Administrators group"""

filer.add_members('Administrators', [('DU', 'bruce.wayne@we.com'), ('DG', 'WE\Domain Admins')])
Gateway.remove_members(group, members)Â¶

Remove one or more members from a local group.

Parameters

  • group (str) â name of a local group

  • members (list[tuple(str, str)]) â a list of 2-tuple members to remove

"""Remove Bruce Wayne from the local Administrators group"""

filer.remove_members('Administrators', [('DU', 'bruce.wayne@we.com')])

"""Remove Bruce Wayne and Domain Admins from the local Administrators group"""

filer.remove_members('Administrators', [('DU', 'bruce.wayne@we.com'), ('DG', 'WE\Domain Admins')])

Active DirectoryÂ¶

Gateway.directory_services_connect(domain, username, password[, ou = None])Â¶

Connect the Gateway to Microsoft Active Directory.

Parameters

  • domain (str) â fully qualified domain name

  • username (str) â username

  • password (str) â password

  • ou (str) â path to an organizational unit

The connect method will first ensure the Gateway can establish a TCP connection over port 389 (LDAP) to domain using Gateway.tcp_connect() prior to attempting to connect

filer.directory_services_connect('ctera.local', 'administrator', 'B4tMob!l3')

"""Connect to the EMEA Organizational Unit"""

filer.directory_services_connect('ctera.local', 'administrator', 'B4tMob!l3', 'ou=EMEA, dc=ctera, dc=local')

Note

the ou parameter must specify the distinguished name of the organizational unit

Gateway.advanced_mapping(domain, start, end)Â¶

Configure advanced mapping from Windows SIDâs to UID/GID values.

Parameters

  • domain (str) â the domain flat name

  • start (int) â start value

  • end (int) â end value

filer.advanced_mapping('CTERA', 200001, 5000001)

Note

to retrieve a list of domain flat names, use Gateway.domains()

Gateway.directory_services_disconnect()Â¶

Disconnect from Microsoft Active Directory.

filer.directory_services_disconnect()
Gateway.domains()Â¶

List trusted Active Directory domains.

Returns

a list of trusted domain flat names

Return type

list

domains = filer.domains()

print(domains)

Cloud ServicesÂ¶

Gateway.connect(server, user, password[, license = 'EV16'])Â¶

Connect the Gateway to CTERA Portal.

Parameters

  • server (str) â the fully qualified domain name or IPV4 address of the Portal

  • user (str) â username

  • password (str) â password

  • license (str) â the type of license to consume, defaults to EV16

The connect method will first validate the license argument, ensure the Gateway can establish a TCP connection over port 995 to server using Gateway.tcp_connect() and verify the Portal does not require device activation via code

Warning

for any certificate related error, this library will prompt for your consent in order to proceed. to avoid the prompt, you may configure chopin-core to automatically trust the serverâs certificate, using: config.connect['ssl'] = 'Trust'

filer.connect('chopin.ctera.com', 'svc_account', 'Th3AmazingR4ce!', 'EV32') # activate as an EV32

filer.connect('52.204.15.122', 'svc_account', 'Th3AmazingR4ce!', 'EV64') # activate as an EV64
Gateway.activate(server, user, code[, license = 'EV16'])Â¶

Connect the Gateway to CTERA Portal using an activation code.

This methodâs behavior is identical to Gateway.connect()

filer.activate('chopin.ctera.com', 'svc_account', 'fd3a-301b-88d5-e1a9-cbdb') # activate as an EV16

Applying a LicenseÂ¶

Gateway.apply_license(license)Â¶

Parameters

Note

you can specify a license upon connecting the Gateway to CTERA Portal. See Gateway.connect()

Warning

all data synchronized from the cloud will be deleted and all unsynchronized changes will be lost.

NetworkÂ¶

Gateway.set_static_ipaddr(address, subnet, gateway, DNSServer1[, DNSServer2 = None])Â¶

Set a static IPv4 configuration.

filer.set_static_ipaddr('10.100.102.4', '255.255.255.0', '10.100.102.1', '10.100.102.1')

filer.show('/status/network/ports/0/ip') # will print the IP configuration
Gateway.set_static_nameserver(DNSServer1[, DNSServer2 = None])Â¶

Set a static name server.

filer.set_static_nameserver('10.100.102.1') # to set the primary name server

filer.set_static_nameserver('10.100.102.1', '10.100.102.254') # to set both primary and secondary

Network DiagnosticsÂ¶

Gateway.tcp_connect(address, port)Â¶

Verify a TCP connection can be established from the Gateway to a target host.

Parameters

  • address (str) â fully qulified domain name, hostname or an IPv4 address

  • port (int) â a port number (0 - 65535)

filer.tcp_connect('chopin.ctera.com', 995) # CTTP

filer.tcp_connect('dc.ctera.com', 389) # LDAP

Mail ServerÂ¶

Gateway.enable_mail_server(SMTPServer[, port = 25][, username = None][, password = None][, useTLS = True])Â¶

Configure mail server to receive e-mail notifications.

Parameters

  • SMTPServer (str) â fully qualified domain name, hostname or IPv4 address of the mail server

  • port (int) â a custom port number (0 - 65535), defaults to 25

  • username (str) â username (in case mail server requires authentication)

  • password (str) â password

  • useTLS (bool) â use TLS

filer.enable_mail_server('smtp.ctera.com') # default settings

filer.enable_mail_server('smtp.ctera.com', 465) # custom port number

"""Use default port number, use authentication and require TLS"""

filer.enable_mail_server('smtp.ctera.com', username = 'user', password = 'secret', useTLS = True)
Gateway.disable_mail_server()Â¶

Disbable mail server.

filer.disable_mail_server()

LoggingÂ¶

Gateway.enable_syslog(server[, port = 514][, proto = IPProtocol.UDP][, minSeverity = "info"])Â¶

Forward logs to a syslog server.

Parameters

  • server (str) â fully qualified domain name, hostname or IPv4 address

  • port (int) â a custom port (0 - 65535), defaults to 514

  • proto (str) â the IP protocol, defaults to 'UDP'

  • minSeverity (str) â the minimum severity of logs to forward, defaults to 'info'

filer.enable_syslog('syslog.ctera.com') # default settings

filer.enable_syslog('syslog.ctera.com', proto = 'TCP') # use TCP

filer.enable_syslog('syslog.ctera.com', 614, minSeverity = 'error') # use 614 UDP, severity >= error
Gateway.disable_syslog()Â¶

Disable log forwarding to a syslog server.

filer.disable_syslog()

SMB Audit LogsÂ¶

Gateway.enable_audit_logs(path[, auditEvents = ['WD', 'AD', 'REA', 'DC', 'WA', 'DE', 'WDAC', 'WO']][, logKeepPeriod = 30][, maxLogKBSize = 102400][, maxRotateTime = 1440][, includeAuditLogTag = True][, humanReadableAuditLog = False])Â¶

Enable SMB audit logs

Parameters

  • path (str) â log file destination

  • auditEvents (list[str]) â list of audit events, defaults to write and delete events

  • logKeepPeriod (int) â keep logs for (days)

  • maxLogKBSize (int) â rotate audit.log file

  • maxRotateTime (int) â rotate audit.log file every (minutes), defaults to 1440 (24 hours)

  • includeAuditLogTag (bool) â

  • humanReadableAuditLog (bool) â log acl changes in a human-readable format

filer.enable_audit_logs('/logs')
Gateway.disable_audit_logs()Â¶
filer.disable_audit_logs()

ResetÂ¶

Gateway.reset([wait = False])Â¶

Reset the Gateway to its default settings.

Parameters

wait (bool) â whether to wait for the Gateway to boot, defaults to False

filer.reset() # will reset and immediately return

filer.reset(True) # will reset and wait for the Gateway to boot

See also

create the first admin account after resetting the Gateway to its default settings: Gateway.add_first_user()

wait (bool) â whether to wait for the Gateway to boot, defaults to False

filer.reboot() # will reboot and immediately return

filer.reboot(True) # will reboot and wait
